options.C: public static void main(String[] args)

questions.question: What will be the time complexity of the following operations?

options.A:
Operation 1: O(n) for ArrayList, O(n) for LinkedList
Operation 2: O(1) for ArrayList, O(n) for LinkedList
options.B:
Operation 1: O(n) for ArrayList, O(n) for LinkedList
Operation 2: O(n) for ArrayList, O(1) for LinkedList
options.C:
Operation 1: O(n) for ArrayList, O(n²) for LinkedList
Operation 2: O(n) for ArrayList, O(1) for LinkedList
options.D:
Operation 1: O(1) for ArrayList, O(n) for LinkedList
Operation 2: O(n) for ArrayList, O(1) for LinkedList

options.B: DispatcherServlet → Controller → Model → View
options.C: Model → Controller → DispatcherServlet → View
options.D: View → DispatcherServlet → Controller → Model

questions.question: What is the difference between @RequestMapping and @GetMapping in Spring MVC?

options.A: @RequestMapping works for all HTTP methods, while @GetMapping is specific to GET requests
options.B: @GetMapping works for all HTTP methods, while @RequestMapping is specific to GET requests
options.C: @RequestMapping is used for class-level mapping only, while @GetMapping is for method-level mapping
options.D: @GetMapping is deprecated and @RequestMapping should be used instead

questions.question: Which statement is TRUE regarding authentication and authorization in Spring Security?

options.A: Authentication verifies what actions a user can perform, while authorization verifies who the user is
options.B: Authentication and authorization are interchangeable terms in Spring Security
options.C: Authentication verifies who the user is, while authorization verifies what actions they can perform
options.D: Authorization always happens before authentication in the Spring Security filter chain

questions.question: What will happen if you add the Spring Security starter dependency to your Spring Boot application without any further configuration?

options.A: The application will not start due to missing security configuration
options.B: All endpoints will be publicly accessible without authentication
options.C: A default user with username 'user' and a randomly generated password will be created
options.D: The application will use database authentication by default

options.C: The test will throw an exception because UserService is not mocked
options.D: The test will use the actual database instead of the mock

options.A: Method A → Method B → Method C
options.B: Method A → Method C → Method B
options.C: Method B → Method A → Method C
options.D: Method C → Method B → Method A

options.D: The controller will return null instead of throwing an exception

questions.question: What is the correct statement about the equals() and hashCode() contract in Java?

options.A: If two objects are equal, they must have different hash codes
options.B: If two objects have the same hash code, they must be equal
options.C: If two objects are equal, they must have the same hash code
options.D: hashCode() must always return a unique value for different objects

questions.question: Which statement about Constructor Injection vs Setter Injection in Spring is correct?

options.A: Setter Injection allows for circular dependencies while Constructor Injection does not
options.B: Constructor Injection is better for optional dependencies than Setter Injection
options.C: Setter Injection provides stronger immutability guarantees than Constructor Injection
options.D: Constructor Injection requires an additional @Inject annotation while Setter Injection doesn't

options.D: It only collects objects with zero references

questions.question: Which of the following statements about Java Class Loaders is correct?

options.A: The Application Class Loader loads classes from the classpath and is a parent of the Extension Class Loader
options.B: The Bootstrap Class Loader is written in Java and loads JDK internal classes from the lib directory
options.C: The Extension Class Loader loads classes from the jre/lib/ext directory and has the Bootstrap Class Loader as its parent
options.D: Class loaders in Java follow child-first delegation model rather than parent-first delegation model

questions.question: Which of the following is a best practice for exception handling in Java?

options.A: Catch Exception at the highest level to simplify error handling
options.B: Convert checked exceptions to unchecked exceptions for convenience
options.C: Use empty catch blocks when exceptions are expected but can be ignored
options.D: Catch the most specific exception type first before catching more general types

options.B: It increases its capacity by exactly 50% and rehashes all entries
options.C: It increases its capacity to the next power of 2 and rehashes all entries
options.D: It creates a new linked HashMap to store additional entries without rehashing
